result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose L Martinez Mendez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 02:27 PM Defendant Jose L Martinez Mendez in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: $150 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Spanish appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court, by phone.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Goldin states the matter be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on March 23, 2021 at 09:55 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case called @ 02:40 PM Defendant Jose L Martinez Mendez in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Atty Goldin appears telephonically.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. No objection by Atty Goldin. Court orders $500 Sig Bond. STC scheduled - NOH given.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2021 at 09:55 am.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Jose L Martinez Mendez not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Court orders forfeiture of $300 Cash Bond previous posted.  Bench Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.

Case called @ 2:39 p.m. Defendant Jose L Martinez Mendez in court. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted. The Court reads the complaint to the defendant.   Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel and will privately retain counsel. Court orders $300 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
